meanings.sent1: The teacher promulgated the test results to the entire class.
meanings.sent2: The new law was promulgated by the government last week.
meanings.sent3: The cat promulgated its presence by meowing loudly at the door.
meanings.sent4: The sun promulgated its warmth across the field, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread being promulgated from the bakery enticed passersby.

meanings.sent1: The mayor promulgated the upcoming festival in a press conference.
meanings.sent2: The company promulgated the new dress code to all employees.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel promulgated its victory over the bird feeder by chattering loudly.
meanings.sent4: The music promulgated through the concert hall, filling the air with melodies.
meanings.sent5: The scent of blooming flowers promulgated through the garden, creating a fragrant atmosphere.
